Property Accountant

Company Name The GPT Group Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 202 views

Job description

Do you want to work for a Top 50 ASX listed business that is transforming the property market of Australia?

At GPT we are passionate about creating spaces that go beyond the expectations of our investors, customers and communities. We create value through our focus on strategic investment and management of high quality shopping centres, office towers, logistics centres and business parks and proudly own a number of prime assets across Australia. Every day we strive to deliver expectational results to achieve our vision to be the most respected property company in Australia. We do this by empowering our people to take initiative and create solutions. We believe our commitment to invest in you is what strengthens the core of our business and keeps us sustainable, focussed and passionate about shaping the future of property in Australia.

Your Opportunity

Working closely with the Divisional Finance Manager you will be across a diverse range of general property financing activities. This role is in a unique position to learn core asset finance instruments and develop and hone key accounting skills. You will be an interested and engaged team member with adroit communication skills.

As Property Accountant your key responsibilities will include;

  • Provide all reporting on time per the monthly finance timetable.
  • Preparation of the month end workbooks, including accruals and base rent reconciliations.
  • Administer the capital expenditure workbook and process, including review of actuals to budget/forecast, accruals and set up and closure of jobs as advised.
  • Completion of balance sheet reconciliations with appropriate detail and explanation of balances.
  • Investigation and commentary on aged or unusual accruals, purchase orders or financial transactions to ensure compliance/comply with financial controls.
  • Process any other month end adjustments as instructed by the Divisional Finance Manager.
  • Manage the calculation of outgoings wash-ups and accruals, forecasted outgoings adjustments and preparation of statements.

What will make you stand out?

To make you stand out from the crowd your skills and experience will ideally meet the below selection criteria.

  • 2+ years of experience in property accounting or similar
  • Degree (Bachelor of Commerce or equivalent)
  • CA/CPA qualified (or near completion)
  • Strong communication and analytical skills
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to multi-task, plan and manage tight deadlines

What makes us stand out?

  • Awarded Employer of Choice 2018
  • Commitment to diversity and inclusion
  • Broad spectrum of diverse and challenging career opportunities available across the organisation
  • Investment in your personal development and future career aspirations
  • Flexible work options available to all GPT employees
  • Competitive remuneration packages and employee benefits

We recognise that providing our people with flexible working options improves our performance, supports wellbeing and improves our lives outside of work. Our mobile workplace technologies and activity based work environments make working at GPT what you do, not where you do it. Explore your options to achieve flexibility including: generous paid parental leave, tailored hours and flexible scheduling, career breaks, study leave, compressed hours, remote working and leave purchase plans.

What are the next steps?

If the above sounds like out then we’d love to hear from you! Click the below link to submit your formal application online and a member of the talent team will be in touch.

Contact the job poster

Siobhan Convey (n\xe9e Worley)

Talent Acquisition at The GPT Group

Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

Senior Accountant - Personal Insolvency

Company Name Cor Cordis Company Location Level 29 360 Collins Street, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 82 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Make a career defining move to a national firm where you will benefit from full support, training, mentoring and a clearly defined career path.

A fantastic opportunity is available to a Senior Accountant to join Cor Cordis in the Melbourne office working in the Personal Insolvency Division.

Cor Cordis is looking for a Senior Accountant who wants to establish and build their career at one of the fastest growing independent business advisory firms in Australia.

Cor Cordis is one of Australia's largest and most trusted business advisory firms providing innovative Advisory, Restructuring & Turnaround and Insolvency solutions nationally through its offices in Melbourne, Sydney, Perth and Brisbane.

As part of your role within our organisation, you will be exposed to a full range of Personal Insolvency appointments, including Bankruptcy and Personal Insolvency Agreements. \xa0

The successful candidate will complete a wide variety of tasks under supervision of qualified and experienced practitioners, including:

  • Dealing with and reporting to creditors, banks and statutory authorities;
  • Conducting investigations into the financial affairs of distressed individuals; and
  • Assisting in the assessment and realisation of assets.

Cor Cordis offers extensive on-the-job training and full support for candidates undertaking the CA and CPA\xa0 qualifications.

Candidates should meet the following criteria:

  • 2 - 5 years experience specialising in personal insolvency
  • A business/ accounting related degree or equivalent
  • Currently completing or have completed CA/CPA
  • An assertive communicator, with strong written and verbal communication
  • Solid technical skills
  • Motivated, with a strong work ethic and flexibility to the challenges of working in a professional environment
  • Strong team orientation
  • Aspirations to lead a team

To be eligible to apply, candidates must have full working rights in Australia.

To apply please send an application cover letter with your resume by 21 September 2018.

Please note that only candidates considered for interview will be contacted.

\xa0

FMCG Category Manager

Company Name Glanbia Performance Nutrition (GPN) Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 283 views

Job description

Data Savvy AND a flair for storytelling?


We’re looking for an up-and-coming Category leader with a passion for shopper insight and a history of category influence with Key FMCG Accounts. Are you ready to make a big impact with a global leader in performance nutrition, health and wellness?


This is a broad spectrum role in a dynamic new team that is quickly building a reputation for category insights and leading product innovation. The Category Manager will be required to demonstrate leadership in setting clear strategy, with unbiased and well founded business recommendations for the mutual optimization of category performance. As a new role it offers the opportunity to get in on the ground level and set up the category function for ongoing success and facilitate rapid growth.



The Position:\xa0\xa0

  • Comprehensive understanding of the principles of Category Management and can articulate a highly compelling category vision.
  • As a customer facing role, the ability to build and deliver compelling sales activation plans and commercially savvy recommendations for key retailers is paramount.
  • Exceptional analysis, reporting and communication skills with proven track record influencing positive growth initiatives and win-win outcomes with Key FMCG Accounts.



The Candidate:

  • Business Degree in Business, Commerce or Marketing.
  • Min 5 years of experience in Category/Business Analysis roles within a FMCG environment.
  • Advanced user of Scan Analysis platforms (Aztec, Neilsen), Space Management platforms (Appollo, JDA) and Business Applications (Powerpoint & Excel).\xa0

Retail Field Coach VIC

Company Name Caltex Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 598 views

Job description



* Bring your high energy and facilitation experience
* Join an energetic and passionate team

At Caltex, we're making life easier for our customers by reinventing our convenience retail and fuel offering. With more than three million weekly customer interactions, we have a huge
opportunity to make an impact not just on our customers, but across our 1900 stores
around Australia.

We are currently looking for an enthusiastic Retail Field Coach to join our Retail team in VIC. This role delivers effective and engaging training solutions that build organisational capability across our retail business.

You'll take us further by:

* Facilitating operational and behavioural training that engages the audience, meets learning objectives and enables change
* Coordinating the logistics of training delivery and administering participant training and attendance records
* Coordinating the training calendar, budget reporting and other ad hoc administration
* Maintaining positive relationships across the Retails Operations business to support training needs
* Assisting in the development and review of training content and initiatives

To be successful you will:

* A Certificate IV in Training and Assessment and facilitation experience
* Experience in the Retail industry
* Strong computer skills including Microsoft office suite and ideally, a Learning Management System

We'll take you further by:

* Offering competitive salary and bonus structures
* Providing professional development and training opportunities
* Welcoming you to our highly-regarded and fun team who are passionate about delivering best in class training solutions to our Retail Business
* Embracing what makes you unique and leveraging your individual strengths in our flexible and inclusive workplace

If we've got your interest, we encourage you to submit an application because we would love to tell you more. Click 'Apply Online' below to register your interest.


At Caltex, we're with you all the way. We keep millions of people moving every day, and continue to be Australia's leading transport fuel supplier and a growing convenience retailer. We're a diverse, multi-faceted business full of people ready to make a difference, and we're evolving which means we've got a variety of career opportunities In different areas.

Our culture is open and team-orientated and lets our employees be themselves while achieving great results. Our core company values - Connect to win, Find new ways, Own it, Make a difference for customers and Never stop caring- act as a roadmap to ensure we continue to make life easier for our customers, for our partners and for each other.

Working at Caltex has many potential benefits, including:

  • Flexible work options (enabled through technology)
  • Career development opportunities
  • BabyCare Package (including a BabyCare bonus).
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Corporate health plans
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Study reimbursement
  • Opportunities to relocate intra and interstate
  • Employee Share Scheme
  • Personal Performance Bonus and Company Incentive Scheme
  • Two x Star Card with a 25% fuel discount, for a privately-owned private-use vehicle


We strongly encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates to apply.

850437245:
[

Project Manager

Company Name Specsavers Company Location Port Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 737 views

Job description

About Us
 At Specsavers, our vision is to provide the best value healthcare to everyone. Simple? Yes. Small-scale? No. We are strongly focused on equipment and technology strategies, close working relationships with healthcare stakeholders and have a clear mission to transform eye health in Australia and New Zealand. We are proud to be at the forefront of leading, shaping and defining the future of the optical and audiology professions.

Attracting the right people to Specsavers is critical for our business, and we are committed to helping every team member reach their full potential by investing in their development and rewarding their commitment.

The Role
 Our dynamic and energetic Project Managers facilitate project teams to employ innovative solutions across a varied portfolio of exciting local and global IT projects. Due to growth within the business, we are seeking a Project Manager to join the IT department in Port Melbourne on a 12-month fixed term contract. In this role, you will take on the vital responsibility of delivering both small and large-scale projects across Specsavers through formal methodology to an agreed scope, cost, time and quality standard.

As Project Manager, you will be responsible for the following duties:
• Maintaining close and effective working relationships to ensure overall project delivery, with key business stakeholders, offshore stakeholders (both international and local) and external vendors
• Managing and co-ordinating the delivery of each project stage from various providers and resources to quality, time and budget
• Identifying, recording, managing and escalating issues through to resolution
• Ensuring solutions are fully tested, including functional, regression, user acceptance, performance and end to end testing as required.
• Ensuring completed projects have been successfully transitioned to Support
• Contributing to development, implementation and maintenance of consistent processes for all IT project delivery activities

About You
Reporting into the Senior Project Manager, you will possess the following skills:
• Formal Project Management qualifications / certifications – Prince II is an advantage
• An understanding of technical IT environments would be advantageous but not a necessity
• An in-depth understanding of project management principles, processes and best practice
• Experience working within a PMO framework, and working in a hybrid Agile and Waterfall environment
• Exposure to working with offshore vendors within a global company would be desirable
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to influence stakeholders at all levels and strong attention to detail
• A strong team player and leader with the ability to motivate and co-ordinate project members
• Highly adaptable to changing environments, and able to deal with and reduce ambiguity
• Driven to succeed and highly resourceful to ensure successful and on-time project delivery

At Specsavers, we are well-known for valuing our people and not only offer competitive reward and benefits but also ongoing development and training. We support creative minds and recognise hard work. If this sounds like you, why wait? Submit your application today!

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Hospital & Health Care
  • Retail

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Information Technology
  • Project Management
